required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mitral Valve Management During Septal Myectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Alfieri Stich Versus Secondary Cord Cutting During Septal Myectomy in Patients With Hypertrophic Obstructive Cardiomyopathy: A Pilot Randomized Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Meshalkin Research Institute of Pathology of Circulation

clinical_study.source: Meshalkin Research Institute of Pathology of Circulation

brief_summary.textblock: Objective of the study: to evaluate whether alfieri technique improves clinical and hemodynamic results compared to transaortic mitral valve secondary cord cutting in patients scheduled to septal myectomy for severely symptomatic hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy.

detailed_description.textblock:
There is pilot prospective randomised study comparing immediate and early results of additional subvalvular mitral apparatus intervention versus additional alfieri stich in patients scheduled to septal myectomy for symptomatic obstructive cardiomyopathy.
Patients with proven hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and resting left ventricle outflow tract obstruction underwent septal myectomy. If patients were suitable for both surgical techniques, they were randomized to alfieri stich or secondary cord cutting. All surgeons were experienced at least 50 related procedures.

primary_outcome.description: Transmitral pressure gradient after the procedures assessed by echocardiography

secondary_outcome.description: Rate of second cross clamping and repeating bypass for procedure related reasons

secondary_outcome.measure: Residual left ventricle outflow tract gradient
secondary_outcome.description: Residual left ventricle outflow tract gradient assessed by direct measurement

arm_group.description: Septal myectomy plus mitral valve repair using alfieri stich
Septal myectomy plus subvalvular mitral valve intervention

intervention.description: Transaortic Mitral valve repair using alfieri technique
Transaortic Mitral valve subvalvular intervention including anterior mitral leaflet secondary cord cutting, papillary muscle release

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy
- Left ventricle outflow tract gradient > 50 mm Hg at rest
- Systolic anterior motion mediated mitral regurgitation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intrinsic valvular heart disease
- Coronary artery disease
- Aortic disease

facility.name: Novosibirsk State Research Institute of Circulation Pathology
